cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast, then expected to arc north-northwest and turn northeast across Louisiana and Arkansas.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border between Port Arthur, TX and Cameron, LA

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast through western and northern Louisiana and adjacent inland areas
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with gusts to 50+ mph are likely during the day on Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation above ground level possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Pass and the lower Neches River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated amounts up to 7 inches could fall across southeast Texas including Beaumont, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and brief coastal flooding at high tide.
